node.title: 5 Ways To Learn Anything Faster [Live Better Series]
node.description:
They don’t teach you this in school. The majority of people think this is a talent that you are born with. Yet, it is one of the most prized skills that you’ll see in any resumes or CVs – “I’m A Fast Learner” they will all say.

They say knowledge is power, and I couldn’t agree more. Love, money, health and career come and go, but knowledge is something that can never be taken away from you. Once you acquire knowledge, it’s with you for life. I believe that the pursuit of knowledge is one of the most important aspirations anyone can have.

However, learning any subject does come with its challenges.

Maybe you feel like you’re a slow learner. Maybe there are one or two concepts that are beyond your grasp. Maybe you’re experiencing an information overload and you’re left dazed and confused. If any of these things apply to you, not to worry because I have just the solution.

In today’s video, I’ll be showing you 5 tips that you can immediately apply for you to learn more effectively. In fact, it’s the same techniques that I personally use for myself throughout my two decades in the field of Chinese Metaphysics.

Knowledge is the best type of investment you can do for yourself. Use it well.

What subject or topic do you want to be learning faster? Share in the comments section below.

JY

node.title: How To Get A Dream Job When Nobody Is Hiring [Live Better Series]
node.description:
Can you find a new job in this economy?

The current pandemic has left millions of people unemployed and jobless. Besides the loss of income, being out of job can also have many negative side-effects such as depression, lowered self-esteem and stress. In the long run, it’s easy to fall into a negative spiral after being laid off.

In spite of this, it’s still possible for you to rise up stronger than ever.
 
Circumstances may have led you to where you are now, but where you will be in the future is entirely within your control. You can even get your dream job if you use the right strategy and mindset. Luck has nothing to do with it… it’s what you do with what you have.

If you or anyone you know is currently looking for a job, then here is something for you. In this video, I’ll be sharing with you the 5 ways you can boost your chances at securing an employment and find success in your career.

I believe that everything happens for a reason. Perhaps the reason behind this is for you to reach greater heights.

Have you found your dream job? Share your experience in the comment section below.

JY

node.title: How To Turn Forgiveness Into Personal Power | 8 Methods According To Chinese Metaphysics
node.description:
One of the most powerful things anyone can do is to forgive. 

We all have gone through pain in our lives. Betrayal, disappointment, hurt… these things are unavoidable. It’s absolutely natural to hold a grudge and sometimes it can even be justified if you were treated unfairly.

However… if you can’t learn how to forgive, you can forget about achieving success.

Keeping these negative feelings and emotions within you can turn everything sour. What matters is not how others have treated you, but how you treat yourself. Keeping grudges, revisiting painful memories again and again would only send you down a negative spiral.

This is why forgiveness is crucial. When you learn to let go, you will have more room for personal growth improvement. In this video, I’ll be sharing with you 8 ways you can be more forgiving using Chinese Metaphysics.

Have you forgiven anyone in your life? Share your story in the comments below.

JY

 #forgiveness #lettinggo #personalgrowth

node.title: Why It’s So Difficult To Get Your Side Gig Started – Here Are The 5 Reasons [Live Better Series]
node.description:
“I don’t know how to do it.”
“I don’t have time for this.”
“My chart isn’t suitable.” 

We all could use some extra cash, right? It’s a great way to supplement your income and at the same time gain new skills and experiences. It can even become your own business eventually. But, for the reasons above, not a lot of people actually get started on their side gig.

The truth is… anyone can start their own side hustle regardless of what their astrology chart says. It can tell you HOW to make it happen, whether you want it to happen or not is up to you.

BaZi also can tell you the obstacles and hurdles that stand in your way. While there’s no such thing as you’re not destined for it, it can shed light to the reason why your mindset is stopping you from getting started in the first place.

In this video, I’ll be sharing with you the 5 reasons why people haven’t started on their side gig based on their BaZi and what you can do to overcome it.

Have you started any side gig recently? Share your story on how you got started in the comments below.

node.title: How To Handle Money According To Your BaZi & Astrology [Live Better Series]
node.description:
They say money isn’t everything… until you need it.

Let’s be real, everything requires money. Whether it’s to achieve your dreams, putting food on the table or sending kids to school, at some point money is definitely involved. It may not be the most important aspect of your life, but it still plays a vital role.

Some people have a negative attitude towards wealth. They feel that money is the root of all evil; Rich people are greedy, rich people are unkind, rich people don’t have time for their family… if you have that sort of perception, you will never be rich yourself.

 This is because your inner self will never allow it to happen.

How you define wealth can either attract it into your life or create an invisible barrier that blocks it away. This attitude is reflected in your BaZi astrology chart and subsequently affects the financial aspect of your life.

In this video, I will be sharing with you the 7 different ways people view money, how you can redefine it and ultimately handle money better according to your BaZi and astrology. Money is not necessarily bad. Let it be a tool to improve your life and the life of those around you.

What’s your attitude towards money? Share your thoughts in the comment section below. 

JY

node.title: Mentors Are Overrated – Here’s Why [Live Better Series]
node.description:
Luke has Obi-Wan. Frodo has Gandalf. Neo has Morpheus. It seems that having a mentor is crucial to any success story… but is it really true?

I believe that the concept of mentors are overrated - here's why? Find out more in my live better series videos.

Life doesn’t always play the way it does in the movies. In reality, there’s no such person who is just waiting for you to appear and impart his or her secrets. In fact, I would even say that it takes a lot of commitment to form a relationship with a mentor.

People seem to have this misconception that the “Noble People” they see in their BaZi chart would be a mentor that would teach them everything and solve all their problems. In truth, the Noble People are simply individuals who are instrumental in your growth… which mean they can even be nasty towards you.

If your whole life is just desperately looking for someone to answer all your questions, you will never truly succeed. If you want success, you have to be independent with or without the “Noble People”. In this video, I’ll shed some light on this entire concept and how you can truly benefit from it.

Don’t wait for things to happen. Make things happen yourself.

Who are the Noble People in your life and what have they done for you? Let me know your experience in the comment section below.

JY

 #mentor #experience #knowledge

node.title: How To Live A Good Life [Live Better Series]
node.description:
What is the good life to you?

Fast cars, financial freedom, someone to enjoy it all with… a good life means different things to each individual. For some, it can even be as simple as having good health. Whatever it is, the definition of a good life is when you have harmony. 

According to classical texts, harmony happens when your elements are balanced. As I’ve mentioned previously, these elements and energies are not literal. They are the metaphorical representation of your thoughts, emotion and mindset. When they are balanced, a good life can be achieved.

Now, I know what you’re thinking. “What if my chart isn’t balanced?”

If you think your chart is bad, believe me, I’ve seen worse. Despite of that, by identifying the opportunities and strength they possess, even these people can and have obtained happiness in their lives. A good life is possible for such charts and I’ll show you how in this video.

Remember, it’s not your astrology chart that determines the quality of your life. It is the choices you make and the actions you take that shape your destiny.

What is the good life to you? Give me your best answers in the comment section below.

JY

 #fulfilment #greatness #happiness

node.title: Finding Happiness In A Chaotic, Distracted and Mundane World [Live Better Series]
node.description:
Think about it, a lot of people live on autopilot.

You wake up, go to work, check your emails, go back home, go to sleep. Rinse and repeat. In this mundane routine, it wouldn’t be a surprise if you wonder at some point if you are truly happy and satisfied with your life. Is there any meaning to it all?

In our search for purpose and inner peace, people tend to look for the answer in all the wrong places. They buy things they don’t need, try to impress people they don’t like and convince everyone that they’re doing great. Evidently, none of these things would bring them happiness and thus this negative feeling amplifies.

To achieve inner peace, you must have balance.

In Chinese Metaphysics, this is achieved by balancing the Five Elements. Despite its name, the elements themselves aren’t literal. They are merely different forms of energy within us that exists as our thoughts, emotions, spiritual and physical being. When you are able to balance these factors together, true happiness can be achieved.

If you want to know how to control your emotions, reprogram your mind and find happiness through all the noises, watch the video until the end. You don’t need anyone or anything to find tranquility. It is and has always been within your grasp.

What is true happiness and inner peace to you? Share your thoughts in the comments below.

JY

 #happiness #peace #meaning

node.title: The Mojo Killer and 4 Ways To Get Out of A Downward Spiral [Live Better Series]
node.description:
Here’s a reality of life… we all get stuck in a rut sometimes.

No matter how motivated you are as a person, at some point in your journey the fire inside of you seem to have died down. You’re no longer as inspired or driven as you were. You’ve lost your way and now you’re feeling like you’re going nowhere. What do you do then?

The first thing you can do is realizing you don’t have to stay down forever.

Escaping the downward spiral may feel difficult, but it’s not impossible. You can take progressive steps towards getting your life back on track and gradually reignite your zest for life. In this video, I’ll be sharing with you the step-by-step guide in how to get out of this rut.

Even the best of us gets stuck occasionally. Everyone, at some point in their lives, experiences this and it’s reflected in their astrological chart. In the long run, it’s only a temporary period of time and whatever you feel might not actually reflect the truth.

If this is where you are right now, stay strong. It can only get better from here.

If you’ve experienced this before and managed to snap out of it, how did you do it? Share it in the comments below and perhaps help someone with your story.

JY

node.title: The Destructive Power of Change & The Good That Comes With It [Live Better Series]
node.description:
Change is good – most of the time, if you see it coming.

In life, we tend to seek comfort and familiarity. We have our routines, what is normal to us and the things we usually expect. When something comes along and disrupts what we are already comfortable with, it gets painful.

From the perspective of astrology, this is known as a “Clash”. It is when the energy that’s coming into your life is in direct opposite of your own and change occurs as a result. To a lot of people, BaZi practitioners especially, it’s not something they look forward to. 

Again, repeat after me… Change is good.

The advantage of knowing metaphysics is that we are able to anticipate these changes in advance. When you know it’s coming your way, you can decide on your own terms how the change should happen. You can even initiate the change itself and be in control. I’ll be explaining how you can do so in this video. 

Remember the last time you tried something new? How about meeting a new person? These things are also a form of clash; changes that happen in your life. They can be happy and exciting experiences. Always remember that changing for the better is always a possibility. Embrace change and it will always be good.

What changes or clashes have you experienced in your life recently and how did you handle it? Share it in the comment section below.

JY

 #change #clash #life

node.title: Breaking the Chains of Resentment [Live Better Series]
node.description:
They say resentment is like drinking poison and hoping for the other person to die. It’s true in a sense that holding on to hatred and anger only hurts one person… yourself. 

In Chinese Metaphysics, everything is energy. Energy naturally attracts one another. If you are resentful, that is what you will attract and manifest into your life. It won’t disappear if it’s constantly on your mind. So, how do you let go of resentment? How can we achieve true forgiveness and release our emotional baggage? 

There are several ways on how you can overcome resentment using Chinese Metaphysics and I’ll be sharing with you some of them in this video. I believe that this is an important step in transforming your life for the better. 

If you can’t let go of the past, you can’t head towards a brighter future. You have much more to gain than to suffer silently. If you have any resentment with you right now, don’t you think it’s about time you let go and move on? If you’re waiting for a sign to do so, this is it.

Forgive others and more importantly, forgive yourself. Live better.

If you have overcome resentment in your own life, share it in the comment section below so you can help inspire others who are currently going through what you went through.

JY

 #resentment #anger #forgiveness

node.title: The Best Way to Predict the Future… [Live Better Series]
node.description:
Do you believe that the universe has a grand plan for you?
Do you think that your destiny is already set in stone?
Do you feel like your life will play out in a certain way?

Astrology is often used to predict the future. People in general are always curious whether they’re destined for greatness or if they’re fated to have a terrible life. Let me ask you this question.

If anyone tells you either of these answers, what would you do about it?

This is a very mundane way to use astrology and it can’t really help transform your life for the better. In one of my previous videos, I’ve spoken about the difference between fate and destiny. Fate is when opportunities present itself and destiny is what you make of it.

I do not subscribe to the fact that anyone’s destiny is fixed. It is about being able to transform and change the life to the way that you want it. The whole idea of astrology is to learn to be in control, NOT to be controlled by destiny. If you want to learn how to design your destiny, then it starts with you taking charge and responsibility over your own life.

So what’s the best way to predict the future? It is by creating it yourself.

What sort of future would you like to create? Share your aspirations in the comments below.

JY

 #prediction #destiny #fate

node.title: Finding Strength When You Feel Like Giving Up [Live Better Series]
node.description:
How many times have you felt like giving up in your life? 
How many times have you felt like giving up this year?

Let’s take this a notch higher... how many of you felt like giving up just this week?

Circumstances can lead anyone into a downward spiral. You might have started out optimistic and passionate, but met with difficulties along the way. When you couldn’t see the light at the end of the tunnel, you give up and become miserable. 

In this negative state, it’s easy to be susceptible to negative influences like fear and doubt. Our energy level becomes lesser and everything seems difficult. Everyone has experienced this at some point in their life.

So what do you do when things are not in your favour and you feel like giving up? Be strong. Before you say “easier said than done,” try this first. In this video, I’ll be sharing with you the 5 steps you can take to help you become stronger even in your worst moments and hopefully, get yourself out of it.

Don’t end up as a pessimist. There is always something you can do to improve your situation.

When was the last time you felt miserable and how did you get out of it? Share your story in the comments below.

node.title: Your Ideal Job Doesn’t Exist [Live Better Series]
node.description:
“Do what you love and the money will follow…”

 “Once you find what you love, the wealth will come…”

“Just follow your passion!”

These are the worst career advises ever. In the real world, your passion may not be what the market demands or what your career requires. You can’t do what you love and expect others to pay for it.

A lot of people think that BaZi astrology can simply tell them what the perfect job is for them or what is “suitable” for them. There is no such thing. Achieving success in your career or business won’t happen if you are not willing to do what it takes. Not everything is going to fit into what you want and be according to what you like.

If you want to achieve success, you have to be great at what you do.

Your astrology chart may point you towards your suitable field or industry, but it won’t be ideal if you suck at the job. In order to make things easier, you have to get better. In order to get anything you want, there is a price to be paid. This is the principle of cause and effect. node.title: Happiness Is A Lie [Live Better Series]
node.description:
Can you be happy and not know it?
Can you be happy even if you’ve yet to find your purpose?
Can you be truly happy even if you haven’t found your soulmate?

I’m sure we all have different answers for the above. Depending on personal experiences or where we are in our journey of life. But one thing we can all agree on is that Happiness is a feeling that comes from within. 

I believe, that no one can be happy all the time. But it’s also true that no one can be unhappy all the time. What makes us human is that we are able to experience both happiness and unhappiness within the same period of time. For those of you who are familiar with the Dao and the concept of Ying and Yang – light exists in darkness, darkness exists in light. Without one, you cannot have the other. 
 
What we’ve been taught or passed down about happiness is a lie. 

In this video, I’ve broken it down to 5 parts. In a Chinese Metaphysics practitioners’ eyes, happiness is when your energy vibrates a positive level. While we go through these 5 parts, maybe you can discover what Happiness means to you and how you can use it to play a more intentional role in your life. 

One last thing… no one except for yourself, can make you happy or unhappy. 

JY

node.title: The 7 Steps To Stop Procrastinating [Live Better Series]
node.description:
"I’ll do it later."
"I can’t think about that right now."
"I’ll start tomorrow."

Society would have us believe that that the cause for procrastination is laziness. That we don’t do something right away and put things off till tomorrow because WE ARE LAZY. But this is where most people are wrong. In fact, this is far from the truth. 

This (procrastination) could happen to any of us. In fact, I’d go so far to say that even some of the most successful people I know have this problem. 

But the fundamental difference is that they (the successful ones) know that to deal with procrastination and overcome it. You see, most people try to deal with it by ‘finding a cure to laziness’.  But in the first place, laziness isn’t the cause of this problem. 

In this video, I’m going to talk about the 7 Steps that I’ve observed over my 2 decades of consulting. With or without Chinese Metaphysics background, you too can apply it. 

JY

node.title: Activating the God of Wealth Sector on 5 February 2019
node.description:
Method to usher the Wealth of God or simply wishes that you want to be able to achieve in 2019 Year of the Pig. The sector and time is researched using the astrological stars and planet position.

1) Prepare a piece of paper and pen.

2) On 5 February 2019 115pm, face the SouthWest

3) Some of you want to use this sector receive the God of Wealth (Cai Sheng), you are welcome to setup your altar and offer your prayers. (For those that are not doing any worshiping, skip this step)

4) Write your full name, and up to 6 wishes that you want it to be accomplished in 2019. (Remember the wish must be something you can accomplished and within your capacity. *eg. I want a billion dollar in my account overnight is not going to work)

5) When you are done, focus your intention on these 6 wishes and send them out to the Universe.

Share with your loved ones, so we can all have a great 2019!

node.title: Qi Men Dun Jia Remote Feng Shui - Key Points - Patricia Lee and Pamela Faye
node.description:
Patricia Lee is a professional consultant and educator based in the United States and works globally.  She is working on a prototype to devise coherent and effective strategies for the modern competitive world. Strategies derived from understanding how all the players are positioned on a chessboard. It uses an objective assessment of the playing field, optimal training and space to reinforce plan execution. It positions you to amplify outcomes of your actions. It merges the tools we are taught with the Art of War aspects that has long been adopted in the business and professional world.

Pamela Faye is a teacher, lecturer and professional consultant in the United States and abroad. Pamela's goal is to target her client's issue and assist them in achieving the goal they desire. Pamela Faye implements her research using Qi Men Dun Jia, date selection, Yi Ying, Xuan Kong Da Gua and strategies from the Art of War. Even though these tools have been used for centuries, many are not aware of them. Pamela is passionate about giving insight and solutions to transforming other's lives. Pamela stays true to her passion of service to others for over 30 years now.

node.title: Four pillars for health and well-being: finding your balance – Beth Grace, USA
node.description: Beth is an international Feng Shui and Chinese metaphysics consultant who has trained with masters in the United States and Asia. She is also a professional astrology who uses Bazi or four pillars astrology and Qi Men Dun Jia, to understand her clients, provide them with life guidance and for business coaching. In addition to Chinese geomancy and metaphysics, she also incorporates dowsing in her work for space clearing, earth energies and water location for well sites.

node.title: Qi Men Dun Jia Software and more - Krzysztof Pazowski, UK
node.description: Technology helps us to achieve results quicker, saves time and money. The online platform Chinese Metasoft is the Chinese Metaphysics hybrid connecting many techniques in one place, multilingual. Practitioners from various schools find the software customisable, fulfilling their needs. The website is famous from the extensive Qi Men Dun Jia charts and its search engine capabilities.  We will see how we can quickly find the special Qi Men Dun Jia structures, the technique which nowadays is applied to business and strategic planning.

node.title: Feng Shui, Chinese Medicine and Holistic health - Simon Brown
node.description:
A look at how feng shui influences the human body. Includes studying internal chi flow through the body, the meridians and how this is influenced by external factors. We explore the relationships between different parts of our home and organs / emotions, and the use of yin/yang and 5 elements as a therapy tool.

Simon Brown Bio
Simon is the best selling author of 9 feng shui books, including The Feng Shui Bible. He has carried out many long term feng shui projects including British Airways, The Body Shop, Paris T2G airport terminal, The Heron Tower, China Construction Bank and Mandali Spa Village near lake Orto. Simon teaches in Japan, India, Spain, Portugal, Sweden, Denmark, US and UK.

node.title: Traditional Feng Shui Decoded -  Feng Shui Master Dr Michael Oon, UK
node.description:
Traditional Feng Shui is a term that has been used frequently. What is it?

Is it a mystical or religious, logical or intuitive? Is it a craft or a body of knowledge for intellectuals? Is this how Feng Shui was practised 300 years ago in the Qing Dynasty or just another modern version? Is it practised by individuals or by a team?

Is it used for residential, commercial or infrastructure? Most importantly, does it work?

Michael Oon will decode the various aspects of Traditional Feng Shui by describing his journey in this Chinese Practice.

node.title: Taijiquan/Qigong  - Feng Shui Master and Architect Howard Choy, Germany
node.description: The main aim of this practice is to achieve self-awareness and full-body relaxation, so your five-senses and your heart/mind can be sharpened as an instrument to perceive the Qi of the environment.

node.title: Blending Hexagrams -  Feng Shui Master Alex Costa, Italy
node.description: The blending hexagrams is a talk, from which one can learn different ways to cross the knowledge of the Hexagrams from Mei Hua (Yi Jing divination) to Xuan Kong da Gua. In this talk three examples will be displayed: 1. find where the problems are coming from, using an easy divination technique. 2. find solutions using the 64 hexagrams. 3. break the boundaries in Chinese metaphysics system and find that QI has not limits.

node.title: How?  What?  Why? -  Feng Shui Master Mike Chester, UK
node.description:
Feng shui can be a very confusing subject to study. You may well have seen different books or heard teachers giving entirely contradictory advice about how certain methods should work or be applied: so how can you know which is right? If you have been studying for a while, then it is likely that you will have questions that nobody seems able to answer. Here is the chance to ask those burning questions that you would like answered.

With his years of experience and his pragmatic engineer’s viewpoint, Mike Chester will endeavour to give logical answers to the questions that you feel you would like to ask

Feng Shui Logos – How to Design Logos and Business Cards with Feng Shui Principles – Jan Cisek (UK)
node.description:
Feng Shui Logos – How to Design Logos and Business Cards with Feng Shui Principles – Jan Cisek (UK)
The 10th Feng Shui Society Conference 14-15 May 2016 London, UK
http://www.fengshuisociety.org.uk/the-10th-feng-shui-society-conference-2016-london-uk/

Having a strong identity is very important in any line of work. When your brand is strong and distinctive it is seen as a mark of quality and trust. Effective branding is the key factor in attracting long term, loyal clients. Although originally feng shui was applied to physical environments, now it is being applied to the virtual environments as brands and websites. You may have a harmonious feng shui at your office but is your feng shui aligned with your brand? Does your logo comply with good feng shui criteria? During this practical talk you will learn how to use feng shui principles in designing logos and business cards (and even your signature which is your personal logo). Please bring your business cards for assessment.

Jan Cisek (MSc Environmental Psychology) is a leading corporate feng shui consultant working in London with a background in design and branding. Jan has produced many innovative solutions in feng shui, branding and logo design and worked with top brands and corporations. More info about feng shui logo design: http://www.fengshuilogos.co.uk

Watch the 10th Feng Shui Conference (2016) on one page here
http://www.fengshuisociety.org.uk/the-10th-feng-shui-society-conference-2016-london-uk/

node.title: Home: How Habitat Made Us Human – John S Allen (USA via Skype link)
node.description:
Home: How Habitat Made Us Human – John S Allen (USA via Skype link)
The 10th Feng Shui Society Conference 14-15 May 2016 London, UK
http://www.fengshuisociety.org.uk/the-10th-feng-shui-society-conference-2016-london-uk/

Whether we live in an igloo or in Buckingham Palace, the fact that Homo sapiens create homes is one of the greatest puzzles of our evolution. John S. Allen will present evidence from evolutionary anthropology, neuroscience, the study of emotion, and modern sociology to argue that the home is one of the most important cognitive, technological, and cultural products of our species’ evolution. This presentation will sheds new light on the deep pleasures we receive from our homes, rooting them in both our evolution and our identity as humans. Home is not simply where the heart is, but the mind too.

John S Allen, PhD, is a neuroanthropologist working at the Dornsife Cognitive Neuroscience Imaging Center and Brain and Creativity Institute, University of Southern California. Originally trained in biological anthropology, he received his undergraduate and graduate degrees from the University of California at Berkeley. John’s latest book Home: How Habitat Made Us Human is available on Amazon/Kindle

Watch the 10th Feng Shui Conference (2016) on one page here
http://www.fengshuisociety.org.uk/the-10th-feng-shui-society-conference-2016-london-uk/

node.title: The Five Aesthetic Principles of Feng Shui – Howard Choy (Germany)
node.description:
The Five Aesthetic Principles of Feng Shui – Howard Choy (Germany)
The 10th Feng Shui Society Conference 14-15 May 2016 London, UK
http://www.fengshuisociety.org.uk/the-10th-feng-shui-society-conference-2016-london-uk/

Feng shui belongs to the Art of Observation (Xiang Shu) in the Taoist Five Arts, consequently the aesthetics of a place or a built-form become part of feng shui considerations. The aesthetic preferences in feng shui is the main focus of this presentation; you will find out what the SUISY principles are and how they can be applied in feng shui practice. By the end of the talk it is hoped that you will understand the aesthetic criterion to use when someone asks ‘What do you think of the feng shui of this building’?

Howard Choy (Cai Hong), (B.Arch.UNSW) is China-trained in classical feng shui and a practicing feng shui architect (B.Arch.UNSW), based in Berlin. Howard is principal of the European College of Feng Shui (ECOFS) and he is motivated to teach and practice classical feng shui to ensure this living tradition from his birthplace can continue to survive and prosper globally. www.fengshui-college.org

Watch the 10th Feng Shui Conference (2016) on one page here
http://www.fengshuisociety.org.uk/the-10th-feng-shui-society-conference-2016-london-uk/

node.title: The Four Pillars of Destiny – Raymond Lo (Hong Kong)
node.description:
The Four Pillars of Destiny – Raymond Lo (Hong Kong)
The 10th Feng Shui Society Conference 14-15 May 2016 London, UK
http://www.fengshuisociety.org.uk/the-10th-feng-shui-society-conference-2016-london-uk/

The Four Pillars of Destiny is a Chinese system using the five elements present at the moment of birth. As such, when an event happens we can examine the Four Pillars at that particular point in time. The presence of elements and their interactions reveal to us a picture that gives alternative clues about what might occurred then. This talk will provide many examples of how the five elements model can shed light on particular events and how the Four Pillars can offer another explanation for a person’s situation.

Raymond Lo, popularly known as “Fung Shui Lo”, is a feng shui and destiny consultant, author and lecturer. He has written over 12 books on feng shui, Four Pillars of Destiny and I Ching divination ((including “Feng Shui and Destiny”). He has appeared on numerous international television shows and in media interviews. He conducts a popular Feng shui Practitioners Training Program. www.raymond-lo.com

Watch the 10th Feng Shui Conference (2016) on one page here
http://www.fengshuisociety.org.uk/the-10th-feng-shui-society-conference-2016-london-uk/

node.title: Feng Shui Tips from Scandinavia – Susanna Utbult (Sweden)
node.description:
Feng Shui Tips from Scandinavia – Susanna Utbult (Sweden)
The 10th Feng Shui Society Conference 14-15 May 2016 London, UK
http://www.fengshuisociety.org.uk/the-10th-feng-shui-society-conference-2016-london-uk/

Scandinavia consists of Sweden and Norway (sometimes also Finland and Denmark) and has a unique style of feng shui. One size doesn’t fit all when it comes to applying feng shui. To make feng  shui work in Scandinavia we need to take the climate into consideration. Seven months of the year are cold and dark.  In this presentation, Susanna will show how the Scandinavian people, have interpreted feng shui for hundreds of years and also show how feng shui is used for contemporary living in Scandinavia.

Susanna Utbult is the founder of Nordic School of Feng Shui and the co-founder of the Swedish Feng Shui Association. Susanna has studied feng shui for the last seventeen years. Susanna has been teaching feng shui since 2004. In addition to teaching, Susanna also works as a consultant, using feng shui, to plan and develop business and homes. More info: www.nordic-fengshui.com

Watch the 10th Feng Shui Conference (2016) on one page here
http://www.fengshuisociety.org.uk/the-10th-feng-shui-society-conference-2016-london-uk/

node.title: Auspicious Date Selection – Norbert Syncak (Slovakia)
node.description:
Auspicious Date Selection – Norbert Syncak (Slovakia)
The 10th Feng Shui Society Conference 14-15 May 2016 London, UK
http://www.fengshuisociety.org.uk/the-10th-feng-shui-society-conference-2016-london-uk/

Auspicious dates are selected for important personal or feng shui activities such as marriages, job applications, business transactions, signing of agreements, constructions and reconstructions, moving in to the house, installation of internal and external features and other events. This talk will be focused on application of various date selection technics (ZE RI art). The real case studies will explain the effect of “Acupuncture of time and space” to the life events and tips and tricks for fast finding the universal auspicious dates with excellent quality of qi.

Norbert Syncak is the founder and principal of Academy of Chinese Metaphysics (Slovakia), trained in the classical feng shui (Malaysia), classical Chinese medicine and acupuncture – Wu Yun Liu Qi and five element style with application of BAZI in acupuncture. He devoted last 25 years to sharing his knowledge in training, workshops and international congresses. www.tradicne-feng-shui.sk/

Watch the 10th Feng Shui Conference (2016) on one page here
http://www.fengshuisociety.org.uk/the-10th-feng-shui-society-conference-2016-london-uk/

node.title: The Influence and Value of Feng Shui in the Modern Built Environment – Manuela Madeddu (UK)
node.description:
The Influence and Value of Feng Shui in the Modern Built Environment – Manuela Madeddu (UK)
The 10th Feng Shui Society Conference 14-15 May 2016 London, UK
http://www.fengshuisociety.org.uk/the-10th-feng-shui-society-conference-2016-london-uk/

All civilisations have left an imprint on the world around them which invariably expresses particular belief systems and cultural norms. These can be identified in the fabric of every city, every town and indeed any landscape that is a product of human contrivance. This talk spotlights feng shui as a belief system with a pervasive influence on many cities and urban spaces, drawing on the value of feng shui as a paradigm that promotes harmony between man and nature. 

Manuela Madeddu, (PhD) is senior lecturer in planning and housing at London South Bank University. Recently her teaching and research has been focused on housing development, the design of places and the quality of new homes. An architect and urban designer, she was in architectural practice in Italy and has worked in urban design in the UK. More about Manuela Madeddu / www.marvarchitettura.com

Watch the 10th Feng Shui Conference (2016) on one page here
http://www.fengshuisociety.org.uk/the-10th-feng-shui-society-conference-2016-london-uk/

node.description:
Electrosensitivity: Non-ionising Radiation, Practical Solutions to Improve Health – Dr Erica Mallery-Blythe (UK)
The 9th Feng Shui Society Conference 9-10 May 2015 London, UK

http://www.fengshuisociety.org.uk/the-9th-feng-shui-society-conference-9-10-may-2015-london-uk/

More and more people are becoming electrosensitive and there is a growing body of research on this subject now. Electromagnetic pollution is now regarded as one of the top pollutants and stressors of modern life. Learn what is electrosensitivity, how it can affect your health and well-being and how to protect yourself or if you’re already electrosensitive what to do about it.

node.description:
Enhancing the Peach Blossom in Our Lives – Dr. Jin Peh (China)
The 9th Feng Shui Society Conference 9-10 May 2015 London, UK

http://www.fengshuisociety.org.uk/the-9th-feng-shui-society-conference-9-10-may-2015-london-uk/

In Chinese culture, the term Peach Blossom signifies romance. In this talk, we will look at the role of romance and relationships in Chinese culture, as well as the traditional symbols of romance. Practical feng shui tips on improving the romance in your lives will also be introduced and common misconceptions pointed out. The talk will conclude with how to assess the potential of Peach Blossom in your life from the Chinese Astrology chart.

node.description:
Using Ming Gua Directional Preferences in Architectural Design – Kristiina Mäntynen (Finland)
The 9th Feng Shui Society Conference 9-10 May 2015 London, UK

http://www.fengshuisociety.org.uk/the-9th-feng-shui-society-conference-9-10-may-2015-london-uk/

Houses are usually planned to ”fit for all”. However, if a house is built for a particular family, the Ming Gua directional preferences of the occupants can be used to guide the design process. In her presentation Kristiina will show how she has done that in the houses she has planned.  The same principles can also be easily applied when we look for the ideal placement and directions in existing living spaces.

node.title: Pactical Feng Shui Tips from Japanese, Korean and Chinese Gardens – Victor H. Garza (China) 9 FSS 15
node.description:
Pactical Feng Shui Tips from Japanese, Korean and Chinese Gardens that Westerners can Apply in their own Gardens, Patios and Balconies – Victor H. Garza (China)
The 9th Feng Shui Society Conference 9-10 May 2015 London, UK

http://www.fengshuisociety.org.uk/the-9th-feng-shui-society-conference-9-10-may-2015-london-uk/

Japanese, Korean and Chinese people have designed gardens for over 1000 years. Whether these gardens are found in a palace, a temple or simply along the streets of an ancient sector of a town or city, these gardens invite us to connect with nature and enjoy the beauty of its arrangement by walking along its paths, bridges, pavilions or pagodas appreciating its flowers, plants, trees and water. A few of the key elements from those gardens could be incorporated in your own garden, patio or terrace making your home or office a small natural sanctuary.

Watch the feng shui conference on one page here
http://www.fengshuisociety.org.uk/the-9th-feng-shui-society-conference-9-10-may-2015-london-uk/

node.title: Connecting Feng Shui with Nature: Greening the City – Gary Grant (UK) 9 FSS Conference 2015 London
node.description:
Connecting Feng Shui with Nature: Greening the City – Gary Grant (UK)
The 9th Feng Shui Society Conference 9-10 May 2015 London, UK

http://www.fengshuisociety.org.uk/the-9th-feng-shui-society-conference-9-10-may-2015-london-uk/

Essentially feng shui is a pro-environmental practice, so how can it help to improve built-up congested neighbourhoods?  Gary Grant will present an ecological approach to urban greening, where nature is brought into our towns and cities in order to increase wellbeing, reduce air and noise pollution, lower temperatures in heat waves and reduce flood risk. He will describe a number of initiatives, including green roofs, living walls and rain gardens in London and inner city locations elsewhere in the world. These systems can be functionally incorporated into urban feng shui projects.

http://www.fengshuisociety.org.uk/the-9th-feng-shui-society-conference-9-10-may-2015-london-uk/

node.title: The Three Lucks: Heaven, Human, Earth – Laurent Langlais (UK) - 9 FSS Conference 2015 London, UK
node.description:
The Three Lucks: Heaven, Human, Earth (The Taoist View on Feng Shui and Life) – Laurent Langlais (UK) 
The 9th Feng Shui Society Conference 9-10 May 2015 London, UK

http://www.fengshuisociety.org.uk/the-9th-feng-shui-society-conference-9-10-may-2015-london-uk/

Feng shui is part of a greater system of  Taoism. In Taoism, feng shui is defined as Earth Luck, one of the classical Three Lucks. The other two, Heaven Luck and Human Luck, are our destiny blueprint and our free will. In this presentation, Laurent Langlais will show you how they constantly interact together to define your life. We will see how you can turn your luck around and how your own Qi (life force) informs us about your optimal timing and best feng shui solutions.

Watch the feng shui conference on one page here
http://www.fengshuisociety.org.uk/the-9th-feng-shui-society-conference-9-10-may-2015-london-uk/

node.title: Colour Psychology: The Energy of Colour – Angela Wright (UK) 9 FSS Conference 2015 London, UK
node.description:
Colour Psychology: The Energy of Colour – Angela Wright (UK)
The 9th Feng Shui Society Conference 9-10 May 2015 London, UK

http://www.fengshuisociety.org.uk/the-9th-feng-shui-society-conference-9-10-may-2015-london-uk/

Colour psychology is the effects of the electro-magnetic radiation of light on human mood and behaviour – a universal, psychophysical reaction, which is not as heavily influenced by culture, age and gender as is generally thought. There is a great difference between colour psychology and colour symbolism. Historically, what is often described as colour psychology is actually colour symbolism – the conscious associations that we are conditioned to make. Cultural responses to colour derive from a variety of causes: for example, green is the sacred colour throughout Islam, being the colour of the Prophet’s robe; in Ireland it is considered lucky, perhaps because when the world around us contains plenty of green this indicates the presence of water and therefore little danger of famine; in England it is considered unlucky, possibly because of its association with decay and disease. During the talk you’ll learn about colour and the energies behind it and its profound effect on human behaviour and why colour is the most influential element in the design mix and therefore in feng shui.

Watch the feng shui conference on one page here
http://www.fengshuisociety.org.uk/the-9th-feng-shui-society-conference-9-10-may-2015-london-uk/

node.description:

8 Feng Shui Conference London UK 17-18 May 2014

http://www.fengshuisociety.org.uk/8-feng-shui-society-conference-17-18-may-2014-london-uk/

This is a largely visual presentation on landform feng shui and its influence on homes, apartments and businesses. We focus on the main door to see how it influences the quality of energy (Qi)  entering the property, how to successfully collect and use the positive aspects, and how to block what is not beneficial. We explore who will be affected and how.

node.title: An Introduction to Astrocartography – Elliot Jay Tanzer / 8 Feng Shui Conference London UK
node.description:
Location, Location, Location – An Introduction to Astrocartography – Elliot Jay Tanzer (USA)
8 Feng Shui Conference London UK 17-18 May 2014


http://www.fengshuisociety.org.uk/8-feng-shui-society-conference-17-18-may-2014-london-uk/

Feng shui is sometimes defined as the art of placement and astrocartography is a locational astrology, which studies life conditions through differences in location. An astrocartography map of the world will show you exactly where each planet was passing over at the moment of your birth and how different locations may have different influences, making it easier or more difficult to manifest your goals and even to resolve personality and health issues. If you’re considering a move to a new location, or want to have more insights into how the current location is shaping your life, astrocartography has the answers.

http://www.fengshuisociety.org.uk/8-feng-shui-society-conference-17-18-may-2014-london-uk/

node.title: Feng Shui Form & Architecture in China – Jodi Brunner / 8 Feng Shui Conference London UK
node.description:
Feng Shui Form & Architecture in China – Jodi Brunner (Australia)
8 Feng Shui Conference London UK 17-18 May 2014

http://www.fengshuisociety.org.uk/8-feng-shui-society-conference-17-18-may-2014-london-uk/

Feng Shui Form & Architecture in China – Jodi Brunner (Australia)
Australians love to travel and in order for us to truly understand the roots of this extraordinary art known as feng shui, at some point in our training it is important to actually travel to China ourselves. Doing so allows us to feel the qi of the place, to visualise the locations where our predecessors have planned their feng shui, and to ponder their techniques and choices. This enriches our knowledge of yin and yang feng shui, form school and Chinese architecture and symbolism. If you have not had the opportunity to travel to China, share with our speaker the wonders of feng shui in its homeland. If you have been to China, Jodi’s presentation will bring back fond memories. Travel with Jodi and her Luo Pan from Xian to Shanghai, Hong Kong to Hangzhou, on a visual tour to places of feng shui significance.

http://www.fengshuisociety.org.uk/8-feng-shui-society-conference-17-18-may-2014-london-uk/
